mittelbayerische.de.307290.1: Ingenious guitarist, drug junkie, cult fan: The co-founder of the band Fleetwood Mac, Peter Green, is dead.

mittelbayerische.de.307290.6: Drummer Fleetwood and guitarist Green had founded the now legendary band in London in 1967, until today his dreamy instrumental hit "Albatross" is unforgotten.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.7: The life of the musician ("The End Of The Game", "In The Skies") resembled a roller coaster ride.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.8: With Fleetwood Mac Green experienced a rapid rise - the band celebrated their greatest successes but then without him.

mittelbayerische.de.307290.17: During most of the 1970s, the musician disappeared from the scene.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.18: He is said to have lived temporarily on the street, worked as a cemetery gardener and spent some time in an Israeli kibbutz.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.19: Green was born in 1946 in Bethnal Green, London, the son of a Jewish working-class family.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.20: At an early age he was enthusiastic about American blues musicians such as B.B. King and Muddy Waters.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.21: At the age of 11, he learned to play guitar.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.22: At the age of 15, the teenager started playing guitar professionally and five years later got the chance to be a lead guitarist for the instrumental band Peter B's Looners.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.23: He was later hired as a replacement for his idol Eric Clapton by the Bluesbreakers.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.24: In the summer of 1967, Green founded Fleetwood Mac with his Bluesbreakers colleagues Mick Fleetwood and John McVie.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.25: The song "Albatross" composed by Green gave the group their first number-one hit in the winter of 1968 / 69 and catapulted them to the top of the British music scene.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.26: But the rapid rise soon showed its downsides: Green did not cope with the media hype, his experiments with the drug LSD became more and more extreme.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.27: He later commented on the life between music and addiction in an interview: "The worst thing that happened to me in life is drugs - the best thing was to land a number one hit".
mittelbayerische.de.307290.28: "Unfortunately, there have been people who have noticed this mistake and pierced it to the press instead of addressing me," Grindel said about the assumption of an expensive clock that had led to his resignation in April 2019.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.29: Towards the end of the decade, in 1979, Green achieved a surprisingly respectful success with an album inspired by religious themes.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.30: Fleetwood Mac swam without him in a new formation on a wave of success.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.31: Their 1977 album "Rumours" sold more than 40 million copies worldwide.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.32: Despite several minor solo successes, Green made no major comeback until he started again in 1996 with a group of friends.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.33: The British "Daily Telegraph" spoke of a rock star returning to Earth.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.34: Green released several albums free of drugs with the Peter Green Splinter Group until the band disbanded in 2004.
mittelbayerische.de.307290.35: For music experts, he was already a blues legend in his lifetime - and with his soft sound one of the most influential guitarists of the past decades.
